Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, OWI (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Bud William Stallings was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).
  • Bud William Stallings was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Bud William Stallings was found guilty of Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment.

Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
The defendant is ordered to random testing. 
Defendant not to operate any motor vehicle:
      without a valid driver's license

Complete Moral Recognition Therapy as directed by the DOC. 
The Def is to obtain counseling/programming as directed by DOC.

The Def, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under WI statutes Sect. 941.29 under the WI Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under WI State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

supervisions.notes: If def is placed on probation or extended supervision & owes financial obligations ordered by the Court at the time of discharge, a civil judgment may be entered against the def for all unpaid financial obligations.

of Requirements and Penalties under Sec. 941.29 & 941.291 
Cases 22CF10 and 21CF11
of Requirements and Penalties under Sec. 941.29 & 941.291

9:02 AM Defendant Bud William Stallings appeared by video, in custody from Bayfield County Jail.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder III appeared by video for Bud William Stallings. Cases 21CM71. 22CF10, 22CF11.  Def waives personal appearance.  State comments on Offer to Settle, just convicted in Bayfield county case 22CF7, state filed amended information this morning change to 5th and 6th OWI in cases 22cf10 and 22cf11.  No objection from Atty, state did send amended filings, def understands amended information and no objections.  State reads over Offer to Settle.  Parties are all in agreement.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with def.  Court goes over elements.  Court finds knowingly, voluntarily, intelligently, waiving rights, court accepts.  
22CF10 CT 2, 3, 4, def PLEADS NO CONTEST CT 1 Dismiss.  Parties stipulate a factual basis for 22CF10, all parties agree, court finds factual basis, accepts pleas, and finds GUILTY in CT 2, 3, 4, and Dismisses CT 1.  
22CF11 CT 2, 3, 4, Def PLEADS NO CONTEST CT 1 Dismiss.  Parties stipulate a factual basis for 22CF11, all parties agree, court finds factual basis, accepts pleas, and finds GUILTY in CT 2, 3, 4, and Dismisses CT 1.  
21CM71 CT 1 Def PLEADS NO CONTEST CT 2, 3, 4, DRI.  Parties stipulate a factual basis for 21CM71, all parties agree, court finds factual basis, accepts pleas, and finds GUILTY in CT 1, and DRI 2, 3, and 4.   
State comments on sentencing. Victim rights have been complied with.  Atty comments on sentencing.  Def makes a statement.  See offer to settle attached for sentencing.
Offer to Settle
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.

02:47 PM - 21 CM 71, 22 CF 10 & 22 CF 11 - Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kenneth W. Ryder appeared by video means for Defendant Bud William Stallings. Defendant Bud William Stallings appeared by phone means.  COVID - ZOOM; wking toward global resolution of all cases & all are OWI cases, req 2 hrs end of June to resolve all.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on April 28, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
